runs.comm: back of a length, with a bit of nip away as was expected. Coetzer is a bit squared up and nudges it towards point
shortish and skirting outside off, Coetzer jumps back in his crease nervously and blocks
almost falls over after delivering a fuller length and demanding the ball to nip back in at the batsman this time. Coetzer is a bit uncomfortable again as he hops and blocks

fullest he's bowled so far, enough for the batsman to go for a drive minus the footwork and Stanikzai at mid-off displays some awful work. Fails to bend down enough and the ball ricochets off his left leg
watches a back of a length delivery at 129 kph sail away to the keeper, great carry to the keeper
realises the angle, not to mention Shapoor's bounce, poses no threat to his off stump and lets it go
starts from wide of the crease and spears in a fuller ball on the pads, Coetzer attempted a flick but has to settle for leg byes. Four of them, so he shouldn't be too miffed

phew! Shane Warne, are you watching this? This should have toppled middle stump after almost pitching outside leg. Just back of a good length to pin the batsman on the crease and he presents a closed face, trying to play the angle and find the gap at midwicket. Instead the ball jags away handsomely and leaves him groping
shortish and on the pads, possibly seeking to reprise that last ball, but the away swing doesn't come and it's picked away to square leg
slides down the leg side and misses the batsman's flick
switches his radar on right and explores the channel outside off. Left quite alone and Nawroz Mangal, one of three slips, runs all the way to the bowlers mark to have a word
shortish and outside off, MacLeod camly watches it pass

picked him out at backward point! He bowled a beauty earlier, this was begging to be hit. Short, wide, four written all over it but Najibullah at point disagrees. Puts his hands up over his head to cut the cut shot down to size. MacLeod cannot believe what he's done
hammers a good length on off stump, Coetzer does a mini-shuffle to protect his off stump and leaves outside it

you've got height, you've got pace, you hit the bat hard and you combine all that with a fuller length on off stump and the batsman is in problem city. Slow to bring the bat down and just about manages an inside edge
shortish and pushed across the right-hander, who gets up on his toes and steers the ball to point
that's how you cut! Sit back in the crease, flay your arms at the ball and also make sure to roll your wrists. Coetzer uses the bowler's pace and make him pay for going short and wide
jumps up to get on top of the bounce and flick a shortish ball off his hips through midwicket
full and darting away outside off, Gardiner isn't tempted
a little shape away for Dawlat again, but Coetzer steps forward and punches it to mid-off
not quite short enough for the cut, although it was wide. Coetzer throws his bat at it and is beaten by some outward movement
good length ball seeking the top of off stump, Coetzer doesn't oblige though, turning the ball through square leg and racing across for a couple
rises up on his tip-toes to handle a shortish delivery that rears up on fifth stump, forced towards point
137kph, it's the length the batsman craves on a pitch with some grass and making the ball misbehave. Short, wide, slammed
pushes him back with a shortish delivery on off stump, defended
fullish delivery at 130 kph, but it's too wide for the batsman to be drawn into a shot
good length on middle and off stump, Gardiner is right behind it. Doesn't quite wander far enough away from point for a single
walks across outside off - telegraphed it - so Shapoor digs in his 135 kph delivery. Gardiner makes the adjustment and tucks it off his hips
sees width, sees red, flays his bat and is beaten. Just enough bounce off the deck for the shortish ball to beat Coetzer's cut

stands rooted to the crease, but his hands were quite eager and it's them that make this shot. Not timed, but he is able to lift a fuller delivery over the off side field and picks up a boundary over cover
shortish on off stump, pushed into the covers
136 kph, targets off stump with a good length ball that keeps the batsman quiet
137kph, touch of curl away outside off, Gardiner is wary of the threat and lets it harmlessly go past and in comes Nawroz Mangal from first slip with a little bit of advice
terrific line and length from Dawlat and the batsman is happy to concede as much. Starts on off stump, swings further away and Gardiner wants nothing to do with it
129kph, back of a length on off stump, defended and the ball strikes bat with a thud

this was pegged as the contest to watch out for in this game and it's turning out to live up to the hype. Dawlat probes a fuller length and gets the ball to jerk away from the forward-pressing Gardiner and beats him handsomely

back of a length and outside off, shoulders arms. And Zazai sees an opportunity. He's spotted Gardiner having taken guard outside the crease. Underarm throw, but it misses. Wouldn't have mattered since his back leg had come back
shortish and outside off, batsman says no thank you
goes a touch fuller, but the response is the same. Not going to bother with it outside off
fluffed it at the third man boundary, has the sub, Nasir Jamal. Coetzer swayed his torso back to make room before unleashing a rasping cut. But it should have been stopped on the boundary.
this time it's full and Coetzer unveils a sparkling straight drive. Solid front foot stride, full face of the bat coming down on the overpitched delivery and sees it on its way
back of a good length and outside off, shuffles across to protect his stumps but does nothing more
fullish and shaping away on middle and leg, Gardiner isn't all to comfortable behind it and gets a thick outside edge past gully
135kph, back of a length and outside off, Coetzer shoulders arms
magnificent drive to meet an overpitched delivery with width, which means Coetzer should feel aggrieved that he hasn't placed it better. Pings into mid-off's hands
makes him jump off his feet as the shortish delivery at 134 kph comes in on middle and leg. Defended into the covers
135kph, not quite overpitched, but he seems to love his drives. Lets the bat flow merrily to meet the ball outside off and drills it to cover
129kph, shortish and the line is on the pads, Coetzer steps inside it and tries to pull it fine. Gets just enough glove for the ball to wander away to fine leg
137kph, gets across to the good length ball outside off and blocks quite well
a bit short and wide, but Coetzer seems to have gotten into the shot a bit too early. Attempts a cut but the awayswing beats him as well
"oh ho ho!" comes the cry from the slips as the good length ball curls away from the batsman, who is content to leave it
follows it up with a 134kph full toss though and it's been flicked only as far as midwicket
pushes him back with his length, Coetzer meets it on off stump and taps it towards mid-on
good length ball a bit outside off, Coetzer had set up for the cut but decides against it
walks at the fuller ball outside off to try and counter the swing, blocked towards point
shortish and straying on the pads and he tickles it off his hips to long leg
steep angle into the batsman, who feels a thud on his pads again as he tries a flick. Wanders away into the leg side for a single
short and wide, it's been happening a bit too often for the kind of pressure Afghanistan can build with their quicks. Slapped to deep third man quite easily
fullish and threatening to cut back in at middle and off stump, Gardiner brings his bat down just in time and runs it past the slips
stays put in his crease and tries to force a good length ball through the covers. Can't succeed
full on middle, blocked stubbornly
keeps it up there for the batsman to drive, and so he does. Hamid leaps up to grab it himself

cuts back in and raps him up on the pads. Enough for the bowler to fly into an appeal, but perhaps the batsman had jumped outside the line. And there could be an inside edge as well. Nabi does well not to review

takes a massive trek outside off to try to upset the bowler's line and ends up being lucky that he wasn't bowled. it was a fuller ball on and around off stump, Gardiner goes for a flick and misses. Was there a tickle though? the keeper certainly thinks so, Hamid concurs, but the umpire disagrees.

full, straight, Gardiner plays all around it and sees the finger raised. Afghanistan are rewarded for keeping to a good plan in helpful conditions and credit to them for staying patient for the batsman to commit an error. Shouldn't have looked to play across the line to a ball that was not darting around. Pinned him in front of the stumps and he has to walk back. Albeit not without a long discussion about DRS. Think he made the right call not to go for it
attempts to cramp him for room, but ends up letting him get off the mark with a flick through square leg
top of off! He's been reluctant to move his feet, he's tried to drive by simply trusting his hands. This time Dawlat gets a fuller delivery to swerve in and exploit the gap between bat and pad.
full on middle, with appreciable shape away. Defended with a resolutely straight bat
134kph, good length ball outside off, pushed in front of point
hit him on the pads, but it was too high. Mommsen is beaten by pace, not to mention the nip in off the seam. Impact was on the back leg after the batsman was late on his flick
135kph, back of a length and outside off. Mommsen is happy for the sighter and lets it pass
more confidence boosting stuff, Afghanistan should not be doling them out like that. Short and wide and Mommsen hammers it away through point. Crisp cut
that shouldn't happen either. Machan is allowed a couple after a drive through the covers. And the reason it got through was a misfield
shortish and outside off, run down to third man quite ably
presents the full face of the bat on a ball that threatened his off stump
seemed to come off the back of the hand, which is why he loses control and offers up a full toss. Worked away wide of mid-on
135kph, fullish on off stump, Machan looks to play it late as he gets forward and defends with soft hands
gets forward as he sees an opportunity to drive, but he was a bit too eager. Gets an inside edge towards mid-off when he was looking for the covers
threaded through the covers! Dawlat is searching for swing and it's there, but he's overpitched the ball. Mommsen takes advantage with a confident forward press and lovely timing
good length ball on middle and leg, clipped through square leg
a bit short and a bit wide, tapped on top of the bounce towards point and there's a misfield from Najibullah. Luckily for him, one of his mates was backing up
nails a yorker on off stump and Mommsen ensures it meets his bat and not the timber behind him
good length ball outside off, Mommsen lets the keeper worry about it
slanted into the pads, and that's what the ball hits to travel behind square leg. Easy single before the keeper catches up with it
good length ball outside off, Mommsen presses forward and shoulders arms

cuts him in half! It doesn't matter he bowls under 120 kph when he can manage to hoop the ball in at the batsman like that. Very close to the inside edge, close enough to off stump as well. Mommsen is lucky
oopsy, follows it up with a short ball and Mommsen hardly needs to push back off his front foot. Pulled masterfully to the midwicket boundary
fuller delivery outside off, defended
good length ball outside off, doesn't interest Mommsen
back of a length and outside off, tapped towards the covers and it's time for drinks
a bit too full and he couples it with some handy width too. All Machan had to do was pierce the gap behind point, and he does so with a lovely open face. Skips away to the short boundary
back of a good length on off stump, eased to third man with the angled bat again. And Machan scrapes some grass off his boots after running down the side of the pitch
gets in line with a shortish delivery on middle and blocks it
fuller and so it swings in at the batsman as well. Mommsen is forward with a solid defensive push
good length ball on off stump, defended
steps forward, almost as if he's constantly telling himself to do so, and defends a good length ball on off stump
teases him outside off and Machan is lured into pushing at it, a bit too early. Gets an inside edge to a fuller ball
good length ball sliding away past the left-hander's off stump, left well enough alone
seems to be the offcutter, which seems to jag away quite sharply from the batsman after pitching
120kph, good that he's trying to bowl full, but not quite that full and not quite that far away from off stump considering his pace. Drilled through the covers

124 kph, there's the edge and it's come as a result of keeping the ball on a fullish length and probing to off stump. Machan was uncertain as he pushed with the bat leading away from his body. Fell short of the lone slip though
stands outside his crease, which he can do considering Gulbadin is bowling around the 120 kph mark and is swinging it quite handsomely. Nudged into the midwicket region
flighted on off stump, Mommsen gets in line with it
has a little nip down the track, but is content to defend the length ball on off stump
tries to lunge forward again as Nabi flights the ball, lap swept past square leg's right
tossed up on off stump at 75 kph, Machan waits on it and tries to pick up a single towards point. No luck
gets forward to a good length ball that takes about an age to get to him. Bunted into the leg side
much quicker this time and Machan is ready for it on the back foot, punched to long-off

the shot of the morning and the crowd agrees, considering the calls of "magnificent." He's looked very compact today and that means overpitched deliveries won't get away. Seemed to just touch the ball, but it screamed away through the covers
waits on a good length ball on off stump and opens the face, a bit risky considering the slip in place but it falls well short of the man and goes past his left as well
good length ball on off stump, kept out
short square boundaries. Need to stay away from affording so much width. Not to mention the cover fielder diving over the ball. Wasn't quite timed, but profits with the drive
right up there, with a little bit of inswing adding to the threat of an almost-yorker.
back of a length and outside off, slid down to third man and someone goes "well played, well played"
works the angle of the ball coming into him and sweeps strongly to deep square leg. Lovely connection and it's enough for the fielder in the deep to fumble and give the extra run
flighted on off stump, driven smartly at short cover
pushed through a bit quicker and Machan is beaten on the sweep. Hit on the front pad, but it was sliding down to spoil the appeal
tossed up on leg stump gets the full face of the bat. Solid thump to long-on
jumps back to a shortish ball on off stump and tries to force it through the covers. Doesn't succeed
flighted on middle and leg, Mommsen's defensice bat stands it the way of it

his timing's been impressive so far, and he's never tried to over-hit the ball. This is on a good length and came from quite wide of the crease. So he had the width to expoit with a tap through point. Brings up the fifty partnership
length, width, tempts him to throw his bat at it. But that's not how he's got his runs and predictably, he doesn't connect.
full and a shade wide of off stump, caressed into the off side
lifted over the infield, but he's managed to place it wide of point. Opened the face as he tried to take advantage of the room outside off on this fuller ball
good length and outside off, Mommsen doesn't want to play it
fuller delivery outside off, eased past mid-off
flighted on middle, clipped through midwicket

he didn't need to do that. He's been nurdling the ball around and trusting his timing to help Scotland recover. This time he tries to make room for himself and clatter a good length ball through the covers. Misses his swing and ends up with his off stump knocked back. Looks disgusted with himself. Bad time for a mistake. Complicated what was essentially a straight delivery
tossed up on off stump, pushed into the covers
gets forward to a flighted delivery and taps it towards midwicket
good length ball on middle, kept out
just a touch close to the pads and it's been clipped to the right of short fine leg
rolls his fingers on the ball to delivery a legcutter that beats Mommsen's flaky push outside off

beautifully done! Terrific accuracy from Gulbadin, nagging away on that off stump line and making the ball nibble this way and that. Mommsen is tentative on the push again and feathers and edge to the keeper
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with
fuller delivery on off stump gets Cross forward and pushing past mid-off
full on off stump, driven calmly to mid-off
good length ball with just enough shape away to keep the batsman on his toes. Berrington leaves again, he knows his team needs to rebuild again
tossed up, with a hint of drift away outside off, defended
goe sback to a good length ball and flicks it past Nabi at square leg
tossed up on the stumps, turned away through square leg again
tries to close the face and work a flighted ball on off stump through midwicket, gets a bit of a leading edge to the bowler
picks a flighted delivery on off stump and clips it through midwicket
gets across to block a good length ball on off stump
pace on the ball, used to his advantage by the batsman. Brings the angled face down on a full ball a shade outside off and picks up a smart boundary through point
right on off stump this time and the fuller length keeps him quiet
good length ball on off stump, taps it behind point and gets the go ahead from Berrington for a quick single
back of a length on off stump, Berrington is squared up as he tries to block. It's still zipping around
goes wide of the crease and pulls of a corker! The angle in ensured Berrington needed to play and then the ball leaps away past the outside edge. Too good
shortish on off stump, Berrington manages to get in line much better with this one
good length ball on off stump, blocked as he suddenly realises there was no turn on the ball
tossed up on off stump, pushed down to long-on
down the track, almost yorks himself in the process. But his wrists are good enough to adjust and flicks to deep square leg
that's seam up from Nabi, and gets some awayswing going too. Cross is beaten on the drive
gets across on middle and off and tucks it to square leg
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
he's quite good at that, spearing a full delivery on off stump and making it move away. Cross manages to get his bat down in time
crisply driven to deep third man as Cross gets confidently forward to a fuller delivery outside off
shortish on off stump, Berrington uses the depth of his crease to block with soft hands
good length delivery on off stump, defended
serious yorker and he targets middle for a change. As if those curlers outside off weren't trouble enough. Berrington just about digs it out. Phew, this is top quality bowling.
good length ball outside off, Berrington is happy not to play at it
good length ball on off stump, all he can do is defend
think it was the seam up again, but Nabi has slid it well down the leg side. Can't blame the keeper for that, definite wide
looped up outside off, Cross' drive finds long-off
a touch flatter and a shorter as well, Berrington taps it to cover
flighted but angling down leg again, which affords Berrington the chance to sweep and sweep well he does
Shenwari pulls in a dive, but he can't stop the single off a flick towards midwicket
too full, too straight, whipped past Shenwari's left for a single to the man in the deep
shortish on middle, he gets inside the line and clips it to long leg
seems to be a bit of leg-roller, he stays beside the line and runs the back of a length delivery to point
a bit short that time and Cross is able to slap it past point's right
poor delivery, it's been a while since one of those reared its face - a short and wide lollipop - that's been carted over point.
made up for it and then some with the next ball. Lured Berrington forward with a good length ball outside off and beat him with a little nip away off the deck
fuller delivery outside off, eased through the covers
length ball on middle, clipped to deep square leg
goes back and punches a good length ball through the covers. Beautiful placement, and lovely footwork too as he jumped back and used all his height to power the stroke
flighted on off stump, turned towards midwicket
loops it up and lands it in a blockhole, whipped to long-on
moves around the wicket and the round-arm action sends the ball down on middle. Worked to square leg
attempts a flick, but the tossed up ball wanders away down leg
good length ball on middle and leg, tucked to square leg as Hamid signs an autograph to a shirtless man with the Afghan colours painted on him
fuller delivery outside off, Berrington isn't keen on it and leaves
goes short and Berrington is not shy of pulling him to the man at deep square leg
short and wide outside off, Cross knows he doesn't need to do anything except saying thanks for the extra
shortish and outside off, slid off the open face to point

Zazai has done it again! Flying full-length to his right and picking up a stunner! Right on the tips of the webbing. And it crowns a brilliant delivery from Shapoor, used his height, banged it in shortish and then gets it to straighten to add to the menace. Cross appears to defend with a bit of an open face and pays for it
fuller delivery on off stump, kept out
seeks the base of off stump, Davey manages to defuse the threat of this yorker

oof, did that touch anything? Nabi tossed it up and managed to defeat the batsman with his slowness and the hint of turn as well. Berrington has looked to push the ball down the ground, but the ball past the inside edge, and deflects off both pads and lands in between the top flap of the keeper's pad and his knee. The review was for caught behind, but there is no spike on snicko. Then we move to HawkEye, which says it pitched in line, impact was in line, but the ball hitting stumps was umpire's call. Looked a lot closer than that  on the lbw
tossed up on middle, Berrington steps down the track and slams it back at Nabi, who picks it up deftly and hurls it in at the keeper to push the batsman back into his crease
flighted on middle, kept out well
tossed up on middle and leg, swept powerfully to deep square leg
fuller delivery on middle and off stump, defended
clipped through midwicket to retain strike
fuller delivery outside off, Davey gets forward and drives into the covers
shortish on off stump, Davey is up on his toes to blunt the ball by his feet
full on off stump, pushed into the covers
good length ball on off stump, defended

Hamid doesn't need to be bowling to pull off an outrageous celebration! Raced in from mid-off, dives forward and picks up a lovely catch to dismiss Davey. Poor shot - a drive on the up to a fuller delivery outside off - especially considering Afghanistan had brought Shapoor back for the express purpose of wickets. And the celebration - Hamid spreads his hands wide with just as wide a smile and tries to roll back and over his head. Doesn't quite succeed though

is that two in two? Nope and Shapoor flashes a big ol grin. It was a fuller ball that skirted down the leg side, Majid Haq, the new batsman wanted to tickle it fine. Don't think there was anything except pad on it.
tossed up on middle and off from around the wicket, defended
flatter and quicker on middle and off, goes for a sweep and misses
good length ball on leg stump, clipped through square leg
fuller delivery outside off, pushed into the covers
slid in on middle and leg, nudged behind square leg
excellent stroke from Berrington, used his feet to get to the pitch of the flatter delivery and hammered it through extra cover. Neat opening of the face and lots of forehand power
opts for a shortish delivery a shade outside off, Majid sways away from the line
back of a length delivery on off stump, blocked
good length ball on the pads though, clipped to deep square leg
shortish and outside off, tapped towards point
full toss outside off, sliced through point
back of a length on off stump, tucked to midwicket

fuller delivery on off stump, Berrington gets across to it to block. He's had to contend with some low bounce as well. Hamid goes up in appeal for ball hitting the back pad before the middle of the bat, and so it did. That could have been tight again. May have been outside off, if anything
good length ball darting back on off stump, defended
starts wide of the crease and gets the back of a length ball to nip away from the outside edge. Beautiful bowling
full and curling in at Berrington, who seems all at sea against the moving ball because Hamid is making it go both ways. Manages to scrounge up an inside edge to fine leg
goes around the wicket to the left-hander, back of a length and outside off, doesn't need to play
fullish and outside off, Haq displays a resolute leave
shortish and sliding down leg, Berrington looks to help it to fine leg but can't connect
gets forward to a fuller ball on off stump and pushes it to cover

whoa! How did that leap over the stumps?! It was a fuller delivery, it ducked back in at Berrington. He was too late on trying to bring his bat in line with the swing and is very lucky to have the ball lob his stumps. Can only flash a little smile and say you were too good for me there, Dawlat
good length ball on off stump, defended

and he delivers! Signals to the fans on the grass banks after trapping Berrington with the one that goes away. A set up as good as any bowler from the major nations. Good length ball brings him forward and hard hands jab at the ball. The outside edge is taken and Zazai is impregnable behind the stumps. Dives to his right and picks up a good low catch
fuller delivery cuts back in at the batsman this time, hits the pad and wanders to midwicket
fuller delivery outside off, pushed towards mid-off
lobs up a wide full toss outside off, Haq misses out as he is beaten with a whippy drive through cover
fuller delivery on off stump, defended
back of a length and outside off, left well alone
banged in short and Haq sways away from the line and sees the umpire call one for the over
fuller delivery outside off, pushed to cover
catches up with the wide full toss this time and slaps it to the point boundary. Neat flick of the wrists the power the stroke

full on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket and he sets off! This is going to be risky and risky it was. Had Shenwari nailed his target at the non-strikers', Evans would have been gone. And it missed by the slightest of a whisker. Like those balls that somehow went over the top of the stumps before from the Afghan bowlers
good length delivery on off stump, defended
good length ball outside off, left well alone
back of a length and outside off, shoulders arms
fuller delivery skirting across the left-hander, with a grunt to boot, Haq refuses to play
brings himself forward to a fuller ball and runs it towards point off the open face
fuller delivery outside off, driven into the covers
good length ball slips past the prodding outside edge of the bat. That wide of the crease angle is causing all sorts of problems because he can jag the ball away off the deck
back of a length on off stump, defended with the open face and gets a single to third man to bring up the 150 for the team
shortish on off stump, tickled through to deep square leg
full and nipping back in through the air this time, Evans gets an inside edge to midwicket as he tries a drive to mid-off
that's going to knock a little sheen off. Fuller delivery pinned with a bit of width, smeared through the covers. Excellent stroke
has him groping at a good length ball that goes on with the angle across the left-hander
fuller on off stump, slid away to third man off the angled bat
seeks a yorker just outside off and almost finds it. Evans is good enough to run it down to third man and get across to the other end
back of a length on off stump and raises a huge clunk off the bat as it thuds into the full face
fuller delivery outside off, Haq is happy to let it go

extra bounce from Dawlat and breaks Haq's bat! And they say these things are monstrous! It's a back of a length delivery on off stump which he tries to block and is surprised by it rearing up at him. Uses soft hands to run it towards slip and gets another shock as he realises a good chunk of his bat is gone
hands on heads time for Naib as this fuller delivery outside off squirts away to the third man boundary. Unmanned region exploited
good length ball on off stump, defended stoutly
back of a length on off stump, blocked
fullish but straying down leg, so Evans has an easy put away to long leg
slower ball wanders down the leg side, is he unable to cope with the left-right pair?
fuller delivery outside off, not bothered with
good length ball outside off, shoulders arms
back of a length and Evans is a little nervous getting in line with it. Gets an outside edge, that falls short of the first slip fielder. Good hands. Resilient batting
good length ball on off stump, defended towards point

clipped into the vacant midwicket region and they've stolen a couple of runs! it was quite tight for Haq getting back to the batter's end. Flat, hard throw but the time it took the keeper to  drag it to the stumps allowed him some breathing space
back of a length on off stump, think Haq was trying to exploit the midwicket region again but can't as the ball holds in the pitch and refuses him the timing he wants
fuller delivery on middle, nudged to mid-on
full on off stump, Haq clips it to deep square leg and they've learned not to risk the arm of the deep fielders
full and wide outside off, flashes and misses
full toss on off stump, Haq clatters it through the covers and lumbers back for a couple before the throw comes in form the deep
slower ball slips away down the leg side and far enough from the batsman's attempted flick
caressed through point and the ball pinged off this new bat of his. A bit too full and a bit too wide from Naib there
good length ball on off stump, defended
picked away off his pads to long leg. Are Afghanistan flagging here a bit?
tossed up on leg stump, nurdled around the corner behind square leg

flightede on off stump, sliced into the covers. There wasn't a single there and Haq would have been out by yards had the target been hit. And to make matters worse, Dawlat at long-on fails to back up. Dives over the ball and lets it through to hte boundary
flighted on off stump, tapped to long-on
good length ball on off stump, kept out
flighted on off stump, defended cautiously
flighted on middle, kept out
good length ball on off stump, pushed into the covers
good length ball, clipped past midwcket
goes back and punches a flatter delivery to midwicket
fired in on off stump, defended
pings him on the pads with a good length ball angled in at the batsman. Evans can't get the flick going
seeks the yorker on middle, backs away and swats to mid-on

back of a length and outside off, Evans backs away again and looks to cart it over cow corner and gets it off the splice. Throws his head back as the ball loops wide of the bowler. And Hamid throws himself into an almost-cartwheel after it
goes short and gets it to skid onto the batsman and Evans is too slow on the pull
nails the yorker on middle and leg, but Evans is able to sneak an inside edge on it and deflect it to long leg
back of a length on and around off stump, Haq doesn't want to get in line at this stage of the game and tries to run it down to third man. Beaten
gives up a full toss outside off and Evans slaps it towards mid-off. Gets it off the bottom of the bat skips off to the other end before Naib, the fielder, can stop him

fuller delivery outside off, Haq looks to drive and gets an inside edge because he hadn't picked the slower ball. Evans has taken off and is too far gone and gives up as he watches Nabi pick up the ball at midwicket and takes aim at the bowlers' end... and misses
fuller delivery slanting down leg, definite wide
full and a shade wide of off stump, this too is a bit slow and sinks below Haq's bat as he attempts a bit of a sweep
length ball on middle, Haq has whipped it over the leg side infield and gets it down to the edge of the midwicket boundary where Shenwari is
that's a beamer and the umpire calls him for it immediately. Haq does extremely well to get inside the line and pull it down to long leg to record Scotland's best World Cup score
that's the stinger. Done and dusted with the slower balls as this 134 kph shortish delivery pins Haq on his back thigh. That'd hurt

acrobatic leap from Zazai, but even he can't get across to the deft little glide from Haq that runs to the third man boundary and brings up the fifty partnership, the second of the innings I think. It's the record ninth-wicket partnership for Scotland too
full and a bit wide of off stump to mess with Evans making room for himself. Slashes and misses
shot! That's Scotland's first 200 in World Cup cricket and it comes off a slower ball that the batsman picked up and pounded over mid-off
loses all his shape and smiles in embarrassment as he targets a length ball as if it had wrong him
good length ball on off stump, slid through the point region and urgent running get them a couple

put the mockers on him, haven't you? Evans runs away outside off to try and scoop the bowler. but he had wised up and delivered a wide yorker. Somehow he gets the back of his back foot to meet with the ball and it deflects to the third man boundary
Shapoor at cover does well as he gets behind a full-blooded drill

clears his front leg and throws his all at a fuller ball outside off. He's held himself back to try and get Scotland to this point, but with only six balls remaining this was the way to go. Only he gets a thick edge that goes high towards point. Naib is down there, has to contend with a swirler and does it well as he dives to his left to hold on to a great catch
full toss on off stump, slashed to deep point
very full and just outside off, Wardlaw tries to jam his bat down in time but can't meet the ball
full on middle, Wardlaw gets a good edge off an attempted push into the off side and hide at the non-strikers'
and midwicket's where this has been bunted to. Backs away to try and swing freely, but Shapoor's angle from around the stumps cramps him right up
length ball on off stump, Evans clears that front leg and scythes away at the ball. Doesn't get all of it as the ball falls into the safe hands of Nabi in the covers
